Are you looking for a top-paying jobs in the civil service but want to remain or relocate to the North East? 
Lower living costs in the region mean your salary stretches even further than it would in London, even with capital city pay-weighting added. 
Various departments have offices in the North East , including HMRC and the Home Office. 
And many of the top-paying public service jobs let you pick where you want to work, although there is often travel involved. 
Looking for a job which pays the salary you want? Try Fish4jobs . 
Here’s five of the best paying civil service jobs available now: Digital Delivery Director, Department for Work and Pensions - based in Newcastle, London or Manchester, £130,000 
This job involves developing platforms to pay and receive money, as well as building products which detect fraud error and recover owed money, 
It involves creating code; and leading security, matrixed architecture and infrastructure operations teams. 
The successful candidate will play an active role within the DWP’s digital executive and senior teams, and be a digital leader across Government departments. Read More 
Apply here . Deputy Director for Organisational Listening and Deputy Director for Customer Culture and Capability, HM Revenue and Customs - North East England, £65,000 - £117,000 
These roles are under development and will see candidates tasked with making sure customer feedback is used to design HMRC strategies, policy and processes. 
The goal is to make HMRC a customer-centric organisation. 
Apply here . Digital Service Programme Manager, HM Revenue and Customs - North East England, £80,000 - £90,000 
The successful candidate will be responsible for leading complex IT projects, and be a visible leader across the programme. 
Responsibilities include: Delivering a complex set of digital services. Taking a lead role in stakeholder engagement activities across HMRC and other departments. Developing and managing the business case, financial approvals and reporting processes for programmes. Making sure projects are released on time and to the desired quality. Collaborating with business, change and technical professions to create a network which can bring in ideas. Director Of Planning, Marine Management Organisation, Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs - Newcastle, £80,000 
The Marine Management Organisation is cleaning up the North East’s coast. 
It needs a director to see the department through the challenges it faces due to Brexit . That includes bringing in marine plans which cover the English coast. 
A track record of leading transformational change with a big organisation will be a major benefit to candidates, as are strong management skills and the ability to work in a professional senior leadership team. 
Apply here . Business Analyst, National Savings and Investments - Durham, £37,285 
Working in Durham , the successful candidate will support the senior business analyst to design and deliver an entity model. 
Responsibilities include: Providing business analysis services across the organisation. Working with business owners to define and track benefits. Support corporate process management, mapping and governance activities.
